item.title: Close Please
item.dc:creator: @kill_you704 kill you704
item.description:
@kill_you704 wrote:

Mate, I’m asking you to stop, I’m not saying your breaking the rules by continuing. Anyways, I told you, I know you are just helping (constructive criticism) but I also said it is not my main priority. Thank you for pointing it out, it will be cleaned when I have the opportunity to move to website again.

item.title: Close Please
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“kill you704, post:7, topic:515309”][quote author=Ruby link=topic=633562.msg4279629#msg4279629 date=1365358327]

Bro, I really did not post this to hear you shit on my programming. I just started and my bad for “using the wrong code.” This was created less than two days ago, and I’m still working on the server and website. If you would like to comment on my thread, please comment something positive. I know you think your comment is positive because its constructive criticism. But coming here and shitting on a website that was my first ever, and created in one day, I really can care less about you telling me I did it wrong.

The design isn’t yours, it’s Apache ah64’s, he used that exact design on Matrix. There’s no where in the rules that it states that someone can’t provide feedback on the server, if you’re going to learn how to do something then learn the correct way rather than using deprecated forms of getting to that conclusion. ALL styling should be done through CSS which is the first thing every website designer should know. I’m not “shitting” on anything, I’m merely stating the faults you’ve made so you can fix them.
[/quote]
I never said you were breaking any rules… I don’t know where you got that from, and I’m asking you to please stop commenting on my thread if you keep on acting this way. I’m honestly confused how moderators are chosen on this site.[/quote]
You’re asking me to stop pointing out issues to avoid bad press towards you? If someone isn’t breaking any rules then they’re free to post on what they wish. If someone is using bad practice throughout their site then I’m going to point it out. If you want to avoid things like that then fix the issues :).

Read full topic

item.title: Close Please
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

Uhh, that website needs a major revamp. It’s full of deprecated code and I don’t really see the need in the changing backgrounds, if you’re going to include changing backgrounds you should add some form of fade or transition to make it more aesthetically pleasing. You’re also using tables for styling which is extremely bad practice; you should only use tables to display tabular data. You’re also using tags which are also deprecated, use the margin: auto; or text-align: center; CSS properties instead.

I only scanned over the code so I may have missed more deprecated features and bad practices but those are the major ones I can find.

Read full topic
